paragraphs.text: I was radicalised by a neo-Nazi group. It could just have easily been Isis.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: It wasn't long after my 13th birthday that I descended into a spiral of heavy drug and alcohol abuse
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It wasn't long after the abuse began that I met Mal, aged 29
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It wasn't that I hadn't learned my wrongs from rights, more that they didn't matter to the group of kids I then found myself around
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Grades or sporting prowess accounted for nothing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Instead
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: accomplishment was measured by something that might actually be achievable: criminal records and the ability to tolerate copious amounts of drugs
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Brownie points were awarded for any period of incarceration, be it in a prison cell or psychiatric facility
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Mal's age alone was enough to earn him a significant amount of street cred in our misfit group of teenage boys
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it was his history of extreme violence that ensured his approval rating was sky high
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He was not just an incredibly violent man, but apparently belonged to a group of them
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: This made him even more attractive
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mal was a member of a then-notorious neo-Nazi organisation with a track record of serious criminal activity
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He regularly turned up at whatever suburban park or abandoned house we found ourselves in
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we sought to consume drugs and booze away from prying eyes
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I didn't find it at all odd that a man pushing 30 was interested in hanging out with a bunch of delinquent teens
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The more drunk we became, the more compelling his violent stories seemed
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: One night Mal invited me to tag along to one of the group's semi-regular gatherings
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: As
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I listened to one of the speakers rally his audience against the "foreign invaders"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I was immediately hooked
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It was not I that had problems, I was told, it was people of another skin colour
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The confusion that had been my constant companion, now viewed through this extremist lens, had suddenly become both figuratively and literally black and white
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: No longer was I to blame for anything
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I didn't need to look at my part in my own downward spiral, as teachers, family members and police kept telling me
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: All life's troubles, it seemed, were the doing of non-whites
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It was a relief to no longer feel responsible for my own - and others' - suffering, but better than that, I was now being called upon to be a vital part of "the solution"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It is, I imagine, the same sentiment a potential jihadist feels when he or she foolishly believes that they're being righteously called upon to fight for the creation of an Islamic state
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as if that might fix what are largely personal troubles
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I became part of a group that would drive around in the leader's ageing hatchback, plastering racist posters on walls and telegraph poles calling for action against the "Asian invasion"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Too dysfunctional to stage any coordinated sort of attack, our race war consisted of nothing more than starting fights with non-whites who were minding their own business
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Since we were always heavily intoxicated, more often than not our victims survived the attacks in far better shape than we did
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Unlike today
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a disenfranchised youth has a raft of violent ideologies to be swept up in
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it was then my pure fortune that my only real option for extremist activity was this poorly led group
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Ongoing action by Asio and the now-defunct special branch of the NSW police and, mostly, the self-implosion of key individuals in the group, meant that by the time I joined it was only a shadow of its former strength
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Thanks to strong family support together with professional help, I was able to leave the group and its racist ideology well behind
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I was eventually diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder following a case of long-term bullying at school
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: While
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that has helped me understand what drove me to this group
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: it is clear that all the factors that leave a young person susceptible to extremist ideology- poverty, lack of education, inadequate mental health support services and general social exclusion - still widely exist across western nations
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I cringe when I hear our political leadership deliver yet another speech extolling a commitment to fighting extremism, yet in almost the time it takes to draw their next breath, go on to announce cuts to community services groups, the kind of organisations whose roles are vital in addressing the risk factors that leave one vulnerable to extremism
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It's not that Orwell was completely off the mark when he said"people sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It is just that by the time the men with guns are needed, the radicalisation process has already happened
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is a process that cannot be stopped by sending troops to regions where most locals couldn't even spell "Australia", let alone have the capacity or even the desire to attack us
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The clear and present danger today, as events from Oklahoma City through most recently to Paris have shown, is that the biggest threats are of the home-grown variety
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The real frontline in the war on terror is to be found in our education and mental health services
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Until
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: such institutions are resourced as freely as our military is
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: then extremists will be here to stay
paragraphs.label: assumption
